ADVISORY COMMITTEES gOR MILITARY MIT13H HBJPHSSMCTm;-!-'Copy of a letter from the Secretary to the Cabinet to the Sec/retary^Greneral.' League of Nations.(Circulated ttot information, with reference to C.P.1501) (Previous lepers C.P.1O90, 1282, 1307r 1416 and 1501).Offloss of the Cabinet,2f Whitehall Gardens, s.ff.1.28th June, 1920.Sir,I am directed by the Prime Minister to acknowledge receipt ot your letter No.20/4/l05 dated 16th June, 1920, asking to be furnished at the earliest possible date with the names of the representatives nominated by the British Government to serve on the Permanent Commission to be con-atitutel under Article 9 of the Covenant of the League.In reply I am directed to say that the Prime Minister has approved of the nomination of the following Officers :*NAVAL.Admiral the Hon. Sir Somerset A.Gough-Calthorpe, G.C.M.G.,K.C.B., C.V.O.MILITARY.Brigadier-General G.S.Clive, C.B., C.M.G., D.S.,0.air.secretary-General, eague of nations, Sunderland House.' Curzon Street,W.1,Group Captain P.R.C.Groves, C.B., C.M.G., D.s.o.i have the honour to be Sir,Your obedient Servant (Signed) M.P.A.HANOT.Secretary,to the Cabinet.
